Module net.automatalib.util
Package net.automatalib.util.automaton.random

Class TabakovVardiRandomAutomata

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.automatalib.util.automaton.random.TabakovVardiRandomAutomata
  • public final class TabakovVardiRandomAutomata
extends Object
    A generator for random NFAs as described in the paper Experimental Evaluation of Classical Automata Constructions by Deian Tabakov and Moshe Y Vardi.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static <I> CompactNFA<I> generateNFA​(Random r, int size, float td, float ad, Alphabet<I> alphabet)

      Generates a random NFA with the given size, number of edges (per letter), number of accepting states.

    • Method Detail

      • generateNFA

        public static <I> CompactNFA<I> generateNFA​(Random r,
                                            int size,
                                            float td,
                                            float ad,
                                            Alphabet<I> alphabet)
        Generates a random NFA with the given size, transition density, and acceptance density.
        Type Parameters:
        I - input symbol type
        Parameters:
        r - random instance
        size - number of states
        td - transition density, in [0,size]
        ad - acceptance density, in (0,1]. 0.5 is the usual value
        alphabet - the input symbols to consider when determining successors
        Returns:
        a random NFA, not necessarily connected

      • generateNFA

        public static <I> CompactNFA<I> generateNFA​(Random r,
                                            int size,
                                            int edgeNum,
                                            int acceptNum,
                                            Alphabet<I> alphabet)
        Generates a random NFA with the given size, number of edges (per letter), number of accepting states.
        Type Parameters:
        I - input symbol type
        Parameters:
        r - random instance
        size - number of states
        edgeNum - number of edges (per input)
        acceptNum - number of accepting states (at least one)
        alphabet - the input symbols to consider when determining successors
        Returns:
        a random NFA, not necessarily connected

      • generateNFA

        public static <S,​I,​A extends MutableNFA<S,​I>> A generateNFA​(Random r,
                                                                              int size,
                                                                              int edgeNum,
                                                                              int acceptNum,
                                                                              Alphabet<I> alphabet,
                                                                              A out)
        Generates a random NFA with the given size, number of edges (per letter), and number of accepting states, written to the given MutableNFA. Note that the output automaton must be empty.
        Type Parameters:
        S - state type
        I - input symbol type
        A - automaton type
        Parameters:
        r - random instance
        size - number of states
        edgeNum - number of edges (per input)
        acceptNum - number of accepting states (at least one)
        alphabet - the input symbols to consider when determining successors
        out - the (mutable) automaton to write the random structure to
        Returns:
        the out parameter after the contents have been written to it
